definition: to touch/to make contact with sth/to stir up sb's emotions
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: Cloaked before me, right within my immediate reach was a beautiful life worth living.
sentences.chinese: 被遮蓋住的是我觸手可及的值得去生活的美麗人生。

sentences.english: Master peer, You the most distance in my fingertips.
sentences.chinese: 朱梓驍，你在我那觸手可及的最遠處。

sentences.english: Commercial space travel is now almost within reach of ordinary citizens.
sentences.chinese: 商業空間飛行現已幾乎觸手可及。

sentences.english: Now the Libya that you deserve is within your reach.
sentences.chinese: 現在，你們所希望擁有的利比亞已經觸手可及。

sentences.english: Victory appeared to be virtually guaranteed, but this time, Usain Bolt messed up on the big stage.
sentences.chinese: 勝利似乎已經觸手可及，但是這次他犯了重大的錯誤。

sentences.english: Now those things are within reach and they are grabbing them.
sentences.chinese: 現在這些東西觸手可及，她們正在盡力得到它們。

sentences.english: A silver moon, almost close enough to touch.
sentences.chinese: 而那一輪銀月卻彷彿觸手可及。

sentences.english: She is one of the famous leading actresses in Hollywood. Fame and fortune is near at hand.
sentences.chinese: 她是好萊塢的一線女星，名和利觸手可及。

definition: ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
flower but no fruit (idiom); handsome exterior but hollow inside/flashy
unattainable/far-fetched/out of reach/exceedingly remote or distant
all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
